intro: Despeleza leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed despeleza, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lipped flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
